result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton T. Stratman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA treatment as recommended by agent
Shall undergo and follow through with domestic violence counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no contact or communication with victim unless the victim and agent consents;  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

14CF3, 31, Defendant Clayton T. Stratman in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  James Thomas Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads no contest to ct. 3, 4 in 14CF3 and amended charge in 14CF31, court finds pleas made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, counts 1, 2 in 14CF3 is DRI, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant makes statement, court heard and sentence imposed.  Arraignments maybe removed from the courts calendar.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:01) Defendant Clayton T. Stratman in court with attorney Stephanie Strickland (will appoint).  Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 cash; Atty. Strickland response; Prelim requested within time limits. new address given (Mail: W2907 Lehman Road, Neosho 53059); Prelim set 2/20/14 at 8:30 in Br. 4; Court sets bond at $500 CASH bond with conditions: #6,6a; #14
